commit_message:
[WIP]

refactor keystone_user, keystone_user_role providers

When domain_specific_drivers are enabled in keystone
'--domain' option is mandatory when requesting 'user list'

Change-Id: I256dd81ada1a9a98e9b2f0f90fae141e7a26c9b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/08/275208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: request('domain', 'list').each do |domain| request('user', 'list', ['--long', '--domain', domain[:id]]).each do |user| domname = domain[:name] if instance_hash.include?(user[:name]) # not unique # user[:domain] is really the domain_id curdomid = instance_hash[user[:name]][:domain] if curdomid != default_domain_id # Move the user from the short name slot to the long name slot # because it is not in the default domain. curdomname = domain_name_from_id(curdomid) instance_hash["#{user[:name]}::#{curdomname}"] = instance_hash[user[:name]] # Use the short name slot for the new user instance_hash[user[:name]] = user else # Use the long name for the new user instance_hash["#{user[:name]}::#{domname}"] = user end # Unique (for now) - store in short name slot instance_hash[user[:name]] = user
deleted_lines: request('user', 'list', ['--long']).each do |user| # The field says "domain" but it is really the domain_id domname = domain_name_from_id(user[:domain]) if instance_hash.include?(user[:name]) # not unique curdomid = instance_hash[user[:name]][:domain] if curdomid != default_domain_id # Move the user from the short name slot to the long name slot # because it is not in the default domain. curdomname = domain_name_from_id(curdomid) instance_hash["#{user[:name]}::#{curdomname}"] = instance_hash[user[:name]] # Use the short name slot for the new user instance_hash[user[:name]] = user # Use the long name for the new user instance_hash["#{user[:name]}::#{domname}"] = user else # Unique (for now) - store in short name slot instance_hash[user[:name]] = user

commit_message:
Fix i9n tests broken due to xvfbwrapper update

Since version 0.2.8 released on Jan 31 self.vdisplay.xvfb_cmd exists no
more before self.vdisplay.start(), so we need to pass options to
framebuffer in a different way. Attribute extra_xvfb_args should be
used for that.

Closes-Bug: #1540495
Change-Id: I4cd4f20f774ffdba8fd1f80ad2ddc2029712c895
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/12/274812/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class Xvfb(xvfbwrapper.Xvfb): def __init__(self, width=800, depth=680, colordepth=24, **kwargs): xvfbwrapper.Xvfb.__init__(self, width, depth, colordepth, **kwargs) self.extra_xvfb_args = [arg for arg in self.extra_xvfb_args if arg is not None] # -noreset is a workaround for memory leak in Xvfb taken # from: http://goo.gl/tmlfm9 # -ac disables X access control self.vdisplay = Xvfb(width=1280, height=720, noreset=None, ac=None)
deleted_lines: self.vdisplay = xvfbwrapper.Xvfb(width=1280, height=720) # workaround for memory leak in Xvfb taken from: http://blog. # jeffterrace.com/2012/07/xvfb-memory-leak-workaround.html self.vdisplay.xvfb_cmd.append("-noreset") # disables X access control self.vdisplay.xvfb_cmd.append("-ac")

commit_message:
Create linux bridge vlans environments

Define environments to create VLANs attached to a single physical nic as
'single-nic-vlans' does, but using linux_bridge instead of ovs_bridge

Change-Id: I8c6fe9ec7028178f783e7d9c0a1cc67a1517eb3d

commit_message:
Make validate_connector_has_setting non-static

validate_connector calls validate_connector_has_setting so it should not
be a static method.

Change-Id: Ice635056f9127794b89c7026f9186a7bf751aa95
Related-Bug: #1541996

commit_message:
Change OpenStack configuration after deployment

Change-Id: I00235aa90178ae349964291aa1404c503ac310fe
Implements: blueprint openstack-config-change
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/97/239897/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================================== Change OpenStack configuration after deployment =============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/openstack-config-change We need a possibility to change OpenStack services configuration after deployment. All necesary services should be reloaded/restarted automatically. ------------------- Problem description ------------------- Now in UI/CLI you can set only small amount of OpenStack configuration options. Final config files includes parameters from many places: - hiera - auto-generated based on other parameters - auto-generated based on hardware (ex. cpu count) - default from osnailyfacter module - default from upstream modules Operator dosen't have tools to modify OpenStack options. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- We will create new puppet resource named 'override_resources'. This resource will handle overriding already existing resources and creating not defined resources. Ex. keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/debug': {value => True} } override_resource {'keystone_config': data => { 'DEFAULT/debug': {'value' => False}, 'DEFAULT/max_param_size': {'value' => 128} } } In that case 'DEFAULT/debug' will be overriden to value False, and 'DEFAULT/max_param_size' will be created with value 128. override_resource will be used in all 'top level' granulars ex. osnailyfacter/modular/keystone/keystone.pp for 'keystone_config'. New parameter hash will be passed to override_resources from hiera. Top level granulars used to override configuration will have new property named 'refresh_on'. .. code-block:: yaml --- - id: keystone type: puppet groups: [primary-controller, controller] required_for: [openstack-controller] requires: [openstack-haproxy, database, rabbitmq] refresh_on: [keystone_config] parameters: puppet_manifest: /etc/puppet/modules/osnailyfacter/modular/keystone/keystone.pp puppet_modules: /etc/puppet/modules timeout: 3600 test_pre: cmd: ruby /etc/puppet/modules/osnailyfacter/modular/keystone/keystone_pre.rb test_post: cmd: ruby /etc/puppet/modules/osnailyfacter/modular/keystone/keystone_post.rb This 'refresh_on' will be used by nailgun to run proper task when user change OpenStack configuration. We will extend Fuel API to be able to upload new configuration for OpenStack services to hiera for given node. We will extend Fuel API to be able to execute proper granular task for given OpenStack configuration parameters. Operator should be able to upload new configuration only for given node, set of nodes or with given role (ex. all computes). Web UI ====== None. Configuration manipulation will be available only to advanced users via CLI. Nailgun ======= Data model ---------- We need to store in DB information about configuration manipulation. Configuration manipulation YAML format is described below. Example: .. code-block:: yaml --- configuration: - name: keystone_config option: DEFAULT/debug value: True - name: nova_config option: DEFAULT/debug value: False REST API -------- API should allow to get/set information about configuration manipulation for given node, set of nodes. Api should allow to upload, execute and upload+execute in single call. When operator choose upload+execute or execute API should execute automatically all necessary granular tasks. API should do validation for each call: - Check if uploaded data has YAML format. - Check if choosen nodes are already deployed. - Check if all passed configuration (puppet resources names) are supported. Orchestration ============= RPC Protocol ------------ None Fuel Client =========== Flow of configuration option manipulation: #. upload YAML: fuel configuration --env 1 --node 1,2,3 --upload file.yaml fuel configuration --env 1 --role compute --upload file.yaml #. execute YAML fuel configuration --env 1 --node 1,2,3 --execute fuel configuration --env 1 --role compute --execute #. upload and execute YAML fuel configuration --env 1 --node 1,2,3 --execute --upload file.yaml fuel configuration --env 1 --role compute --execute --upload file.yaml Plugins ======= It is possible that after plugin deployment, operator will override parameter used by plugin. But we should remember that this feature is designed only for advanced users. Moreover plugin developer also can set 'refresh_on' in plugin tasks. Fuel Library ============ We need to prepare new puppet resource responsible for overriding puppet resources. We need to modify all 'top level' granulars to override configuration for each OpenStack service. ------------ Alternatives ------------ Instead of using new puppet resource (override_resources), we can start passing hash from hiera to all OpenStack services. This way if operator want to change options, he should upload (via API), new configuration which will be uploaded to hiera with highest priority. After that nailgun will simply reexecute proper granular tasks which will change conf files. Cons: - Review/rewrite multiple puppet manifests to use hash. Pros: - No need to find 'top level' granulars. - No additional puppet resource. -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- None --------------- Security impact --------------- New API should have standard Fuel API authentication enabled. It is possible that on some nodes operator will have differenet (unsafe) configuration options set. -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- None --------------- End user impact --------------- In some cases configuration manipulation can lead to service disruption. This feature is designed on for advanced users, because there is possibility to destroy running cluster. ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ In most cases none. Different set of configuration on different nodes can lead to hard to debug performance problems. ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- None ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- None -------------------------------- Infrastructure/operations impact -------------------------------- None -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- We need to prepare documenation which will describe this feature. -------------------- Expected OSCI impact -------------------- None -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Work Items ========== * Extend API to allow to store and execute configuration manipulation YAML * Write override_resources puppet resource * Modify all 'top level' granulars Dependencies ============ Some OpenStack services are configured not by dedicated puppet resource, but with concat/file_line/exec, we will not be able to override configuration created this way. Some OpenStack services (Neutron) use multiple puppet resources to set configuration in sigle file. We should work with neutron upstream to handle this. ----------- Testing, QA ----------- Acceptance criteria =================== ---------- References ----------

router_external maps to router:external Neutron Net property.

commit_message:
Added template format specification doc
small fixes to template format

Change-Id: I710ed43982b231e5c77a9a4e6cd60b4e6f99a2d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/33/272033/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================== Vitrage Templates Format ======================== Overview ======== In Vitrage we use configuration files, called "templates", to express rules regarding raising deduced alarms, setting deduced states, and detecting/setting RCA links. This page describes the format of the Vitrage templates, with some examples and open questions on extending this format. Template Structure ================== The template is written in YAML language, with the following structure. :: metadata: ... definitions: entities: - entity: ... - entity: ... relationships: - relationship: ... - relationship: ... scenarios: scenario: condition: <if statement true do the action> actions: - action: ... The template is divided into three main sections: - *Metadata:* Contains the template ID, and list of search words/tags to help with future indexing (optional) - *Definitions:* This section contains the atomic definitions referenced later on, for entities and relationships - *Entities * describes the resources and alarms which are relevant to the template scenario (conceptually, corresponds to a vertex in the entity graph) - *Relationships * the relationships between the entities (conceptually, corresponds to an edge in the entity graph) - *Scenarios:* A list of if-then scenarios to consider. Each scenario is comprised of: - *Condition * the condition to be met. This condition will be phrased using the entities and relationships previously defined. - *Actions * an action list to execute when the condition is met Condition Format ---------------- The condition which needs to be met will be phrased using the entities and relationships previously defined. An expression is some logical combination of entities and relationships. Expression can be combined using the following logical operators: - "and" - indicates both expressions must be satisfied in order for the condition to be met. - "or" - indicates at least one expression must be satisfied in order for the condition to be met (non-exclusive or). - "not" - indicates the following expression must not be satisfied in order for the condition to be met. - parentheses "()" - clause indicating the scope of an expression. The following are examples of valid expressions, where X, Y and Z are relationships: - X - X and Y - X and Y and Z - X and not Y - X and not (Y or Z) - X and not X **NOTE:** Most templates will require only the "and" operator, which will be the first operator supported for Mitaka. Examples ======== Example 1: Basic RCA and Deduced Alarm/State -------------------------------------------- The following template demonstrates 1. How to raise a deduced alarm. Specifically, if there is high CPU load on a host, raise alarm indicating CPU performance problems on contained instances. 2. How to link alarms for purposes of root cause analysis (RCA). Specifically, if there is high CPU load on the host and CPU performance problems on the hosted instances, we link them with a "causes" relationship. 3. How to use a single template for several different scenarios. :: metadata: id=host_high_cpu_load_to_vm_cpu_suboptimal definitions: entities: - entity: category: ALARM type: HOST_HIGH_CPU_LOAD internal_id: 1 - entity: category: ALARM type: VM_CPU_SUBOPTIMAL_PERFORMANCE internal_id: 2 - entity: category: RESOURCE type: HOST internal_id: 3 - entity: category: RESOURCE type: INSTANCE internal_id: 4 relationships: - relationship: source: 1 target: 3 type: on internal_id : alarm_on_host - relationship: source: 2 target: 4 type: on internal_id : alarm_on_instance - relationship: source: 3 target: 4 type: contains internal_id : host_contains_instance scenarios: scenario: condition: alarm_on_host and host_contains_instance actions: - action: type: raise_alarm properties: alarm_type: VM_CPU_SUBOPTIMAL_PERFORMANCE target: 4 - action: type: set_state properties: state: SUBOPTIMAL target: 4 scenario: condition: alarm_on_host and alarm_on_instance and host_contains_instance actions: - action: type: add_causal_relationship properties: source: 1 target: 2 Example 2: Deduced state based on alarm --------------------------------------- The following template will change the state of a resource to "ERROR" if there is any alarm of severity "HIGH" on it. Also note that entity ids can be strings as well. :: metadata: id=deduced_state_for_all_with_alarm definitions: entities: - entity: category: RESOURCE internal_id: a_resource # entity ids are any string - entity: category: ALARM severity: HIGH internal_id: high_alarm # entity ids are any string relationships: - relationship: source: high_alarm target: a_resource type: on internal_id : high_alarm_on_resource scenarios: scenario: condition: high_alarm_on_resource actions: - action: name : set_state properties: state: ERROR target: a_resource Example 3: Deduced alarm based on state --------------------------------------- This template will cause an alarm to be raised on any Host in state "ERROR" Note that in this template, there are no relationships. The condition is just that the entity exists. :: metadata: id=deduced_alarm_for_all_host_in_error definitions: entities: - entity: category: RESOURCE type: HOST state: ERROR internal_id: 1 scenarios: scenario: condition: 1 actions: - action: type: raise_alarm properties: alarm_type: HOST_IN_ERROR_STATE target: 1 Example 4: Deduced Alarm triggered by several options ----------------------------------------------------- This template will raise a deduced alarm on an instance, which can be caused by an alarm on the hosting zone or an alarm on the hosting host. :: metadata: id=deduced_alarm_two_possibile_triggers definitions: entities: - entity: category: ALARM Type: ZONE_CONNECTIVITY_PROBLEM internal_id: 1 - entity: category: ALARM Type: HOST_CONNECTIVITY_PROBLEM internal_id: 2 - entity: category: RESOURCE type: ZONE internal_id: 3 - entity: category: RESOURCE type: HOST internal_id: 4 - entity: category: RESOURCE type: INSTANCE internal_id: 5 relationships: - relationship: source: 1 target: 3 type: on internal_id : alarm_on_zone - relationship: source: 2 target: 4 type: on internal_id : alarm_on_host - relationship: source: 3 target: 4 type: contains internal_id : zone_contains_host - relationship: source: 4 target: 5 type: contains internal_id : host_contains_instance scenarios: scenario: condition: (alarm_on_host and host_contains_instance) or (alarm_on_zone and zone_contains_host and host_contains_instance) actions: - action: type : raise_alarm properties: alarm_type: VM_CONNECTIVITY_PROBLEM target: 5 Open Issues / TBD ================= Inequality ---------- Consider a template that has two entities of the same category+type, say E1 and E2 both are instances like this: :: metadata: id=two_similar_instances definitions: entities: - entity: category: RESOURCE type: HOST internal_id: host - entity: category: RESOURCE type: INSTANCE internal_id: instance1 - entity: category: RESOURCE type: INSTANCE internal_id: instance2 ... relationships: - relationship: source: host target: instance1 internal_id: link1 - relationship: source: host target: instance2 internal_id: link2 ... There are three options of how to interpret this template: - *instance1 == instance2.* This option is not a reasonable one, as in this case the template can be written with only *instance1* - *instance1 != instance2.* - *instance1 != instance2 or instance1 == instance2.* In other words, either option is fine. Thus, we need a way to distinguish between options 2 & 3 (as option 1 can be expressed by using only instance1). This can be done in two ways: 1. Introducing another logical operator "neq", to be used between expressions: :: condition: (instance1 neq instance2) and... 2. Using this as a relationship type "neq": :: relationship: source: instance1 target: instance2 type: neq Cardinality ----------- To support cardinality, for example to express we want a host to have two VMs on it, we could take different approaches. 1. One approach would rely on the "neq" relationship described above. Similar to the example given in the previous section, stating that the two VMs on the host are not equal is equivalent to a cardinality of two. 2. A different approach would be to expand the definition of the "relationship" clause. By default cardinality=1 (which will support backward compatibility) For example, we might use the one of the following formats :: - relationship: # option A source: host target: instance target_cardinality: 2 # means there are two instances, but only one host type: contains internal_id: host_contains_two_instances_A - relationship: # option B, same meaning as option A but split into two lines source: host target: instance cardinality_for: instance cardinality: 2 type: contains internal_id: host_contains_two_instances_B

commit_message:
Add support for root-disable

Added the route action for disabling the root user in the extensions.

Modified the resource extension to allow the generation of a DELETE
route on the resource itself.

Implemented root-disable on the mysql guest.  Added not implemented
error messages for all other datastores.

Change-Id: I52519b86c47694c554b624d1d2fbe7a001af55fc
Partially implements: blueprint root-disable
Depends-On: I27831eb361c2b219a9623f152b9def73a2865d67

added_lines: def delete(self, req, tenant_id, instance_id): """Disable the root user for the db instance.""" LOG.info(_("Disabling root for instance '%s'.") % instance_id) LOG.info(_("req : '%s'\n\n") % req) context = req.environ[wsgi.CONTEXT_KEY] try: user = guest_models.RootUser() user.name = "root" user.host = "%" found_user = models.User.load(context, instance_id, user.name, user.host, root_user=True) if not found_user: user = None except (ValueError, AttributeError) as e: raise exception.BadRequest(msg=str(e)) if not user: raise exception.UserNotFound(uuid="root") models.Root.delete(context, instance_id) return wsgi.Result(None, 200)

commit_message:
Reverts a workaround that is impacting amp updates

This patch removes a workaround database call that causes old
data to be pushed to the amphora haproxy configuration.

Change-Id: I7199a744700e446c1481b1b46d274b8a763730d6
Closes-Bug: #1542120

commit_message:
Abstract accesses to policy engine

To be easy to switch to the new architecture, API models use an abstracted
class to access Policy Engine. When Congress uses the architecture, set
the distributed_architecture to True. Same abstraction can be used to
accesses between policy engine and datasources, and between API models and
datasources.

This is like POC for the abstraction, it's needed to make tests for the
class for merge.

Change-Id: Ie95cdac193866a107a0cdcba706dab0ad2eee32c
Partially-implements: blueprint dist-api-rpcify-policy

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import functools from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def distributed_method(dse_func): def _distributed_method(func): @functools.wraps(func) def distributed_wrapper(*args, **kwargs): if cfg.CONF.distributed_architecture: ret = func(*args, **kwargs) else: ret = dse_func(args[0].engine, *args[1:], **kwargs) return ret return distributed_wrapper return _distributed_method class DSEPolicyEngine(object): def __init__(self, dse_engine): self.engine = dse_engine def dse_get_policies(self, *args, **kwargs): return self.engine.get_policies(*args, **kwargs) def dse_get_policy(self, *args, **kwargs): return self.engine.get_policy(*args, **kwargs) def dse_delete_persistent_policy(self, *args, **kwargs): return self.engine.delete_persistent_policy(*args, **kwargs) def dse_execute_action(self, *args, **kwargs): return self.engine.execute_action(*args, **kwargs) def dse_create_persistent_policy(self, *args, **kwargs): return self.engine.create_persistent_policy(*args, **kwargs) def dse_simulate(self, *args, **kwargs): return self.engine.simulate(*args, **kwargs) class PolicyEngineAPI(object): """API class for Policy Engine. API class for calling Policy Engine Class. This wrapper class swichs executed methods depending on it's configuration """ def __init__(self, engine): if cfg.CONF.distributed_architecture: # Create an instance of the Data Service Engine class for # the distributed architecture. self.engine = None else: self.engine = DSEPolicyEngine(engine) @distributed_method(DSEPolicyEngine.dse_get_policies) def get_policies(self): """A method calling a method in new data service engine.""" raise NotImplementedError( 'distributed architecture is not implemented yet.') @distributed_method(DSEPolicyEngine.dse_get_policy) def get_policy(self): """A method calling a method in new data service engine.""" raise NotImplementedError( 'distributed architecture is not implemented yet.') @distributed_method(DSEPolicyEngine.dse_delete_persistent_policy) def delete_persistent_policy(self): """A method calling a method in new data service engine.""" raise NotImplementedError( 'distributed architecture is not implemented yet.') @distributed_method(DSEPolicyEngine.dse_execute_action) def execute_action(self): """A method calling a method in new data service engine.""" raise NotImplementedError( 'distributed architecture is not implemented yet.') @distributed_method(DSEPolicyEngine.dse_create_persistent_policy) def create_persistent_policy(self): """A method calling a method in new data service engine.""" raise NotImplementedError( 'distributed architecture is not implemented yet.') @distributed_method(DSEPolicyEngine.dse_simulate) def simulate(self): """A method calling a method in new data service engine.""" raise NotImplementedError( 'distributed architecture is not implemented yet.')

commit_message:
run Puppet OpenStack integration jobs on puppet-ceph

Puppet OpenStack integration jobs deploy Ceph on scenario001 using
openstack/puppet-ceph module.
This patch aims to run integration jobs for puppet-ceph so we can
provide feedback to puppet-ceph group at how the module work in an
OpenStack environment.

Change-Id: I02af643fab760ab983f3a73df086f188d4d82a96

commit_message:
Changed EC backend from jerasure to liberasurecode in examples and docs

liberasurecode_rs_vand is build-in liberasurecode, so you don't need
another depedency libjerasure2.

liberasurecode_rs_vand is supported by pyeclib from 1.0.8
version, so bumping version up.

Closes-Bug: #1534325
Change-Id: If2d96875694df8fd48c5278395859aaa165cb566
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/16/274416/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not use __builtin__ in python3

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3, use
six.moves.builtins instead.

Change-Id: I58d456669abcbc58c9a3df8f15f24996a71b299b
closes-bug: #1290234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/16/262516/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six.moves.builtins as builtins
deleted_lines: if six.PY2: import __builtin__ as builtins else: import builtins

commit_message:
Remove microseconds from apache log(s)

Remove the microseconds from the apache logs and move back to using
milliseconds. There is no longer any 2.2 workarounds in the keystone
setup process.

Change-Id: I8787eee41fbde1f9794aeffe1e862af0d5117bc3

commit_message:
Sync L3Driver, NullL3 interface with LinuxNetL3

Commit 59ac254 added a new positional argument 'is_external' to
the LinuxNetL3.initialize_network method.

Update initialize_network for L3Driver and NullL3 to sync interfaces.
Add a unit test to check that LinuxNetL3 and NullL3 interfaces match
L3Driver interface.

Change-Id: If6f4340a07a4ed7b7c7873a52c97bca38f3ffe48

commit_message:
Make v3 identity_client consistent

identity_client of v3 API was inconsistent and it was against the
pep8 T110 rule. This patch fixes these inconsistencies.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Iee460fac7eda8b0c02129e26448304b3c135019e

commit_message:
Add Magic Search Filtering to NG Flavors

This adds magic search filtering to the NG Flavors table.

To test set DISABLED = False in _2081_admin_flavors_panel.py

Change-Id: I6e64c0122fdb2d48c9c94ca11fa43ac6fe23c602
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-flavors
(cherry picked from commit e1bf99d05153b39b9f1f0ad46cce15938af3b356)

commit_message:
output_graph method fix.
when using json_graph.node_link_data, it puts in default
'id' in the each vertex properties with the value of the vitrage_id
implements: blueprint static-synchronizer

Change-Id: Id7b518b934f9063efbaaf4ef2395077753556f40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/08/277708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from vitrage.common.constants import VertexProperties as VProps node_link_data = json_graph.node_link_data(self._g) for node in node_link_data['nodes']: if VProps.ID in self._g.node[node[VProps.ID]]: node[VProps.ID] = self._g.node[node[VProps.ID]][VProps.ID] return json.dumps(node_link_data)

commit_message:
Truncate image name in admin/images table

If you view /admin/images and /project/images, you will see that a long
image name is truncated in /project/images but not /admin/images.  This
commit updates openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/images/tables.py to
truncate the displayed image name to 40 characters, as is currently
being done in
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/tables.py.

Change-Id: I68ac044ae57550284d833ad0433b091595819530

commit_message:
Add note about ironic config options

Add a note to config.py: ironic config options
need to be kept here (in tempest) until Liberty EOL.

added_lines: # NOTE(deva): Ironic tests have been ported to tempest-lib. New config options # should be added to ironic/ironic_tempest_plugin/config.py. # However, these options need to remain here for testing stable # branches until Liberty release reaches EOL.

subject: Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-02 13:20:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8aa04661ba4f5b34d8485ed7be1aacf48c1b3e3c', 'message': "Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in deleting
task-state while resizing was in progress are not updated accordingly on
nova-compute start-up. This is because in present code if quota delta is
negative then reserved quota is not updated while committing the quota.

Added new flag 'reverse_quota' default to False in quotas object commit()
method. With this change it is possible to reverse the reserved quota,
if delta is negative and reverse_quota value is True.

Change-Id: I424e31c39baa4d7c96bb29687cfa45b7a6092e32
Closes-Bug: 1296414
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-03 11:22:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5d5a24270f8726903d23beffae93992e370780d5', 'message': "Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in deleting
task-state while resizing was in progress are not updated accordingly on
nova-compute start-up. This is because in present code if quota delta is
negative then reserved quota is not updated while committing the quota.

Added new flag 'reverse_quota' default to False in quotas object commit()
method. With this change it is possible to reverse the reserved quota,
if delta is negative and reverse_quota value is True.

Change-Id: I424e31c39baa4d7c96bb29687cfa45b7a6092e32
Closes-Bug: 1296414
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-14 07:26:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e2241b871a2f0b6b8e024ca51141baebb34e6d22', 'message': "Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in
deleting task-state while resizing was in progress, are not updated
accordingly on nova-compute start-up. This is because in present
code if quota delta is negative then reserved quota is not updated
while committing the quota.

Added new db interface to get latest migration object based on
instance id, as there might be many migration records for the same
instance id. To calculate correct quota delta, it requires latest
migration record.

Added new flag 'reverse_quota' which default to False in quotas
object commit() method. With this change it is possible to reverse the
reserved quota, if delta is negative and reverse_quota value is True.

Added code to pass correct in_use quota to _delete_instance method
and update the reserved quota if instance was resizing when user has
sent request to delete the instance.

Change-Id: I424e31c39baa4d7c96bb29687cfa45b7a6092e32
Closes-Bug: 1296414

commit_message:
Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in
deleting task-state while resizing was in progress, are not updated
accordingly on nova-compute start-up. This is because in present
code if quota delta is negative then reserved quota is not updated
while committing the quota.

Added new db interface to get latest migration object based on
instance id, as there might be many migration records for the same
instance id. To calculate correct quota delta, it requires latest
migration record.

Added new flag 'invert_quota' which default to False in quotas
object commit() method. With this change it is possible to invert the
reserved quota, if delta is negative and invert_quota value is True.

Added code to pass correct in_use quota to _delete_instance method
and update the reserved quota if instance was resizing when user has
sent request to delete the instance.

Change-Id: I424e31c39baa4d7c96bb29687cfa45b7a6092e32
Closes-Bug: 1296414
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/18/170118/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def resize_quota_delta(context, new_flavor, old_flavor, sense, compare): """Calculate any quota adjustment required at a particular point in the resize cycle. :param context: the request context :param new_flavor: the target instance type :param old_flavor: the original instance type :param sense: the sense of the adjustment, 1 indicates a forward adjustment, whereas -1 indicates a reversal of a prior adjustment :param compare: the direction of the comparison, 1 indicates we're checking for positive deltas, whereas -1 indicates negative deltas """ def _quota_delta(resource): return sense * (new_flavor[resource] - old_flavor[resource]) deltas = {} if compare * _quota_delta('vcpus') > 0: deltas['cores'] = _quota_delta('vcpus') if compare * _quota_delta('memory_mb') > 0: deltas['ram'] = _quota_delta('memory_mb') return deltas def upsize_quota_delta(context, new_flavor, old_flavor): """Calculate deltas required to adjust quota for an instance upsize. """ return resize_quota_delta(context, new_flavor, old_flavor, 1, 1) def reverse_upsize_quota_delta(context, migration_ref): """Calculate deltas required to reverse a prior upsizing quota adjustment. """ old_flavor = objects.Flavor.get_by_id( context, migration_ref['old_instance_type_id']) new_flavor = objects.Flavor.get_by_id( context, migration_ref['new_instance_type_id']) return resize_quota_delta(context, new_flavor, old_flavor, -1, -1) def downsize_quota_delta(context, instance): """Calculate deltas required to adjust quota for an instance downsize. """ old_flavor = instance.get_flavor('old') new_flavor = instance.get_flavor('new') return resize_quota_delta(context, new_flavor, old_flavor, 1, -1) def reserve_quota_delta(context, deltas, instance): """If there are deltas to reserve, construct a Quotas object and reserve the deltas for the given project. @param context: The nova request context. @param deltas: A dictionary of the proposed delta changes. @param instance: The instance we're operating on, so that quotas can use the correct project_id/user_id. @return: nova.objects.quotas.Quotas """ quotas = objects.Quotas(context=context) if deltas: project_id, user_id = objects.quotas.ids_from_instance(context, instance) quotas.reserve(project_id=project_id, user_id=user_id, **deltas) return quotas

commit_message:
Use OS::Nova::Server resource type for instance metadata

Horizon currently uses the OS::Nova::Instance resource type when
querying for instance metadata, but it should use OS::Nova::Server
to align with Heat and Searchlight.

See also:
  https://review.openstack.org/272271

Closes-Bug: #1537903
Change-Id: I1deab8ed74515d08301e68bd2c75604d35592c50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/47/275747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from the OS::Nova::Server namespace of the glance metadata definitions.
deleted_lines: from the OS::Nova::Instance namespace of the glance metadata definitions.

commit_message:
IBM XIV/DS8K: Implements Replication V2

This patch implements cinder Replication version 2 as proposed in
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/replication-v2

the changes are:
1. the ability to enable replication on the specified volume
2. the ability to disable replication on the specified volume.
3. the ability to return the list of replication targets for a volume
4. the ability to force failover to a secondary replication target.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint ibm-xiv-ds8k-replication-v2
Change-Id: I04d1db17762fe72add2ab34193946daeca2f88e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/90/269490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_replication_updates(self, context): """Get replication updates.""" return self.xiv_ds8k_proxy.get_replication_updates(context) def replication_disable(self, context, volume): """Disable replication on the specified volume.""" return self.xiv_ds8k_proxy.replication_disable(context, volume) def replication_enable(self, context, volume): """Enable replication on a replication capable volume.""" return self.xiv_ds8k_proxy.replication_enable(context, volume) def list_replication_targets(self, context, volume): """Provide a means to obtain replication targets for a volume.""" return self.xiv_ds8k_proxy.list_replication_targets(context, volume) def replication_failover(self, context, volume, secondary): """Force failover to a secondary replication target. """ return self.xiv_ds8k_proxy.replication_failover( context, volume, secondary)

commit_message:
TEST: Troubleshoot FC test failures

A few CIs are getting the error message "Validate volume connection
failed (error: 'staticmethod' object is not callable)" when running
tempest tests. This is just for troubleshooting to print out the full
exception details when that happens.

Change-Id: I1821e0768ddc07e91940ea963e09dcd90dd134a8

commit_message:
Bump paramiko from 1.13.0 to 1.16.0

The 1.16.0 version of paramiko includes support for sha2. Previous
to this only md5 and sha1 were available for the key exchange.
Those hashes are considered weak and vulnerable whereas sha2 is
not.

Change-Id: I12fae394506ce6f18ca7f438f3eb9e5abe51d901

commit_message:
Replace exit() with sys.exit()

The exit() function is added by the site module so that it can be used
in the interactive interpreter. It's use is not recommended in
applications:
https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html#constants-added-by-the-site-module

Co-Authored-By: David Stanek <dstanek@dstanek.com>
Closes-Bug: #1542587
Change-Id: Ic6a1fe7f3925b0efd34111713cc56857757b29cf

commit_message:
Spec to add resources-links in resource list API Response

bp add-resources-links

Change-Id: Ic85c9c76fd77a3d0a54e4b72957decde15109768
Related-Bug: 1504641
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/14/264114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================ Add resources-links in resource list API Response ================================================ Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-resources-links When GETing some resource, the returned list of resource respects the osapi_max_limit configuration paramter but does not provide a link to the next element in the list. Problem description =================== This is bug [1]_ about volume resource, which returned list will respects the osapi_max_limit configuration parameter but does not provide a link to the next element in the list. It will always return first few elements and marker parameter will been ignored. However there are other resources have same issue. Following resource had this issue: * volumes * snapshots * security_groups * server_groups * virtual_interfaces Use What --------- Users will never request remaining items when items number had exceded osapi_max_limit in nova configuration because of response will not contain next element's link. By adding next element link, users can request remaining items. Proposed change =============== We need to add 400 status code to list api. Because of next element link will contain marker parameter. If users offer not found marker in request link, then api need to response bad request which is 400 status code. This spec will add resources_links attribute in api response. Therefore we need to allocate the next microversion number. Necessary changes can reference [2]_. List resource exceded limitation Response (Use volume as example): Current: :: { "volumes": [ { "id": "$(id)s", "status": "$(status)s", ... } ] } After: :: { "volumes": [ { "id": "$(id)s", "status": "$(status)s", ... } ], "volumes_links": [ { "href": "$(url)s?marker=$(id)s", "rel": "next" } ] } Attribute resources_links will be added in Response. Alternatives ------------ As alternate we can directly add resources_links to response. But this will break v2.1 schema of list API response. This will cause tempest gate test failed. Because of it is testing based on v2.1. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- New attribute resources_links will be added as microversion. * Specification for the method * Description * API Volume List * API Snapshot List * API Security Group List * API Server Group List * API Virtual Interfaces List * Method type * GET * Normal http response code(s) * 200, no change in response code * Expected error http response code(s) * 400, request marker parameter can not find suitable item in resource. * URL for the resource * 'os-volumes' * 'os-snapshots' * 'os-security-groups' * 'os-server-groups' * 'servers/<server_uuid>/os-virtual-interfaces' * Parameters which can be passed via the url * limit * marker * offset * JSON schema definition for the response body data if any * Add resources_links to every resource's schema response body :: { 'status_code': [200], 'response_bopy': { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'resources_links': { 'type': 'array', 'items': { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'href': { 'type': 'string', 'format': 'uri' }, 'rel': {'type': 'string'} }, 'additionalProperties': False, 'required': ['href', 'rel'] } } } } } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: lyanchih Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Add 'volumes_links' in volume list response * Add 'snapshots_links' in snapshots list response * Add 'security_groups_links' in security group list response * Add 'server_groups_links' in server group list response * Add 'virtual_interfaces_links' in virtual interface list response * Allocate new microversion number Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit tests for each resource list with new microversion number * Tempest still not suport API microversion tested Documentation Impact ==================== * nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst document will be updated References ========== .. [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1504641 .. [2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html#other-necessary-changes

commit_message:
Refuse to delete compute service if host is in host aggregate

User need to remove host from host aggregate, before removing the compute
service. Otherwise, host aggreate will deny to remove this host, because
compute service does not exist. And user will not able to delete this host
aggregate either, because it is not empty. This code change prevents user to
remove a compute service, before removing its host from host aggregate.

Change-Id: I1ba2b5242f2c1ceb78e13d8041da26722d2b0b1c
Related-Bug: 1470341
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/65/262165/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Refuse to delete compute service if host is in host aggregate ========================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1470341 Problem description =================== Currently Nova API allows user to remove a compute service, even if its host is added into a host aggregate. After removing that compute service, the user will never be able to remove its host from host aggregate. And the user will not be able to remove the host aggregate, because the host list of this agregate will never become empty. Use Cases --------- User must remove host from host aggregate, before removing its compute service. Otherwise, Nova api should refuse to delete the specified compute service. Proposed change =============== This API code change prevents user to remove a compute service, before removing its host from host aggregate. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- * Proposes to add a new error response to delete service api * The existing delete service api need to return http code 409, if the specified compute service is in host aggregate. * Method type: DELETE * Normal http response code is unchanged * Expected error http response codes: * 409: the specified compute service is in host aggregate * Other error http response codes are unchanged * URL for the resource * ``/v2/{tenant_id}/os-services/{id}`` * ``/v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-services/{id}`` * No parameter can be passed via the url * JSON schema definition for the request body data is unchanged * JSON schema definition for the response body data is unchanged * Example use case: Request: DELETE /v2.1/ae811d961fc24050a1dea10aa28d3a5c/os-services/10 Response: { "conflictingRequest": { "message": "Compute service of zhaoqin is in host aggregate zhaoqin.", "code": 409 } } * No policy change Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zhaoqin Work Items ---------- 1. REST API update Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Functional tests will be added to validate the API responses. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== * This is the Nova bug link, which describes the problem. https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1470341

commit_message:
Flavor Classes

This describes a concept to group flavors together in order use those
groupings to scope policy and quotas.

This was approved as a backlog spec before the mitaka spec freeze
deadline via Ia0b2ac4b42f02c821ae5b36f008d66d5ef963a34.

Co-Authored-By: Andrew Laski <andrew.laski@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I171f82e1bf3209a7efdab2746015938940ed4e14
Previously-approved: mitaka
Implements: bp flavor-classes

commit_message:
Introduce Disk and Memory Monitor Plugin for Compute

At present to get the actual utilization on the compute only the CPU plugin
in available. There are various occasion when the admin would like to know
the actual utilization of disk and memory on the compute. With this feature
we would like to introduce two new monitor plugins one for disk and other
for memory to report the actual usage statistics. These statistics will be
dumped into nove.compute_nodes tables as part of the metrics column and can
be fetched from the API. Also the scheduler changes to understand these
metrics will be included as part of this feature.

Change-Id: If23caae200deb56afa71421d70965e9817893bfb
Implements: blueprint disk-memory-monitor-plugin
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/67/254467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================= Introduce Disk and Memory monitor plugin for Compute ======================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/disk-memory-monitor-plugin At present to get the actual utilization on the compute only the CPU plugin in available. There are various occasion when the admin would like to know the actual utilization of disk and memory on the compute. With this feature we would like to introduce two new monitor plugins one for disk and other for memory to report the actual usage statistics. These statistics will be dumped into nove.compute_nodes tables as part of the metrics column and can be fetched from the API. Also the scheduler changes to understand these metrics will be included as part of this feature. Problem description =================== None Use Cases ---------- In private cloud where the instance snapshots are created locally on the compute host having the usage information could be very useful. Right now there can be various instances when the compute_nodes.disk_available_least and free_disk_gb can be negative as they are not the correct attributes$ to measure the actual usage. Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== Proposed change is to write new monitor plugin for disk and memory to fetch the actual usage data from the compute node. The collected data will be collected by the periodic run of Resource Tracker and later dumped into nova.compute_nodes table metrics column. The actual usage information can be a very useful information at the nova API layer. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vilobhmm Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- 1. Introduce Disk Monitor plugin. 2. Introduce Memory Monitor plugin. 3. Unit tests for Disk Monitor plugin. 4. Unit tests for Memory Monitor plugin. 5. Functional tests for Disk and Memory Monitor plugin. 6. Logic to grab data in Resource Tracker. 7. Logic to dump the data in nova.compute_nodes table. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Move WSGI functionality from nova into oslo.services

Change-Id: I4dab65c20fde6b3eee4a8de8c6c8b86705247aa0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/88/237588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Movement WSGI functionality in oslo.service library =================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.service/+spec/move-wsgi-server-in-oslo-service Nova like many other projects(cinder, neutron, glance, eth.) contains eventlet WSGI functionality. Implementations of this functionality in many projects are similar or even copied and pasted. To avoid side effects related with copy-pasted code it should be moved into separate library. First step is adding of generic WSGI in oslo.service. The next steps are removing old WSGI from components and reusing oslo.service WSGI. Problem description =================== Copy and paste programming usually is bad practice( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copy_and_paste_programming). Fixes and improvement of generic code should be duplicated in other projects. Since this rule is rarely complied generic code becomes less and less similar. As result: to apply trivial fix in WSGI functionality it takes much more time. Use Cases ---------- This improvement impacts on developers and quality of whole openstack code. Proposed change =============== I propose to clean openstack from copy-paste. First of all generic WSGI code should be put in oslo library. Actually it is already put in oslo.service library. The next steps are: removing WSGI code from projects and reusing library's code. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- WSGI functionality will be moved from nova/wsgi.py to oslo.service/wsgi.py. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Marian Horban <mhorban@mirantis.com> Work Items ---------- * Put generic WSGI code in oslo.service library(already done). * Remove WSGI code from nova. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Since this BP doesn't add new functionality additional tests are not needed. Documentation Impact ==================== WSGI functionality is removed from nova. References ========== None. History ======= None. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Mitaka - Introduced

commit_message:
Improve nova attach volume api to support disk-bus

The purpose of this spec is to add disk-bus paramter
to nova attach volume api.

Blueprint: improve-nova-attach-volume-api-to-support-disk-bus
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/63/241063/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== improve nova attach volume api to support disk-bus ================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/improve-nova-attach-volume-api -to-support-disk-bus The purpose of this spec is to add disk-bus parameter to nova attach volume api. Problem description =================== Currently when using attach volume api, nova automatically decides which disk_bus is used in virt-io according to the virt-type, device-type and device-name. User can't specify disk-bus parameter explicitly in nova attach volume api, which leads to many inconveniences such as the inability for users to utilize the bus type they desire, the extra care and attention needed to be paid for the device name that is available on the current instance to be attached, and so forth. Also user can use 'hw_disk_bus' image property, but each hypervisor have different disk bus, different disks even one disk(SSD) can use different disk_bus in the same VM, and user generally does not set this parameter when they want more than one hypervisor using the same image, so we should allow user to override image disk settings with their own preferred "disk_bus" when they attach volumes. Use Cases ---------- * One VM to be able to attach different disks (thus different disk_bus) * One Image to be able to be used by different Hypervisors (each of which has different disk_bus) * multi-channel (SCSI, NVMe) support for the volume attach process, it is mainly for SSD disk, which can use qemu SCSI or NVMe bus, user can decide to use which bus from a performance view. Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== The proposal is to add disk-bus paramter to nova attach volume api. When user only specifies disk-bus, Nova then would generate a device-name for volume based on virt-type and disk-bus. When user specifies both disk-bus and device-name, Nova then will need to determine if disk-bus and device-name matches. When user didn't set disk_bus, nova will decide a bus using virt-type, device-type and device-name. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- "bus" will be added to attach volume api in version 2.1 and is optional. It and should be used when user want specify disk-bus. The new attachment API will have the following schema definition:: create_volume_attachment = { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'volumeAttachment': { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'volumeId': parameter_types.volume_id, 'device': { 'type': 'string', # NOTE: The validation pattern from match_device() in # nova/block_device.py. 'pattern': '(^/dev/x{0,1}[a-z]{0,1}d{0,1})([a-z]+)[0-9]*$' } 'bus': { 'type': 'string', 'maxLength': 255, }, }, 'required': ['volumeId'], 'additionalProperties': False, }, }, 'required': ['volumeAttachment'], 'additionalProperties': False, } Request:: POST /v2.1/?{tenant_id}?/servers/?{server_id}?/os-volume_attachments { "volumeAttachment": { "volumeId": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803", "device": "/dev/vdd" "bus": ["scsi"|"virtio"|"ide"|"usb"|"sata"...] } } The 'bus' parameter is added and optional in the request and should be used when user want specify disk-bus. Response:: 200 OK { "volumeAttachment": { "device": "/dev/vdd", "bus": "virtio", "id": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803", "serverId": "0c92f3f6-c253-4c9b-bd43-e880a8d2eb0a", "volumeId": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803" } } The 'bus' parameter is always return in the response. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- There will be a new 'bus' parameter in Nova Attach volume CLI. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zhangni <zhangni@huawei.com> Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Enhance Nova attach volume API. * Enhance each hypervisor attach volume function. * Enhance Nova-client attach volume CLI. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add unit test and tempest test for Nova Attach volume API. Documentation Impact ==================== * CLI Doc http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/content/ * API Doc http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html References ========== None History ======= None

commit_message:
Add suport for libvirt driver to start lxc from rbd volume.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/lxc-boot-from-rbd-volume
The purpose of this blueprint is to enable start a LXC containers from a rbd volume.

Change-Id: If38db2afab7ec5e05dcfb1c0c36097e412514b75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/77/251177/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. ========================================== Add suport for libvirt driver to start lxc from rbd volume. ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/lxc-boot-from-rbd-volume The purpose of this blueprint is to enable start a LXC containers from a rbd volume. Problem description =================== Currently, Libivrt driver does not support starting Lxc container from Rbd volume because LibvirtNetVolumeDriver class can't attach the rbd volume to hypervisor. We need to attach the volume first to the hypervisor, As the developement of rbd-ker is behind that of userspace librbd We plan to use qemu-nbd to attach the volume to hypervisor. Use Cases --------- Anybody who wants to start lxc container from a rbd volume. Currently this is not supported at all. Proposed change =============== In order to support start container from rbd volume we plan to implement RBDImage mount function in instance_for_format() with NbdMount class, With that wo could mount the rbd volume to container_dir in _create_domain_setup_lxc function to support lxc boot from rbd volume. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: 542727233-qq <yuanzhi.cao@kylin-cloud.com> Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- - Add logic to the instance_for_format() to support the RBDImage mount. - Write some code in _create_domain_setup_lxc() to get the suitable disk_path and Image_model to use setup_container() mount the RBDImage to container_dir. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Optimize NUMA topology based deploys on PowerPC

PowerPC architecture does core based scheduling for processes.
Openstack's libvirt driver presently only does thread based
cpu scheduling. The same libvirt driver is used in case of
PowerPC based systems as well.

This spec attempts to optimize the use cases w.r.t
NUMA cell affinity and dedicated cpu pinning for PowerPC.

Change-Id: I3994e6fcbb4648424f405194e0f9fff26c176956
Blueprint: numa-optimization-ppc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/96/251296/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Optimize NUMA deployments for PowerPC architechture =================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/numa-optimization-ppc This spec proposes to ensure that NUMA cell affinity and dedicated cpu pinning works optimally on PowerPC architecture. This is applicable for the PowerPC hosts that use the libvirt driver only. Problem description =================== PPC based hosts use core based scheduling for processes. This means that the operating system on the host has a visibity to the cores instead of the hardware threads to allocate processes for execution. Currently, the Openstack NUMA cell affinity and dedicated cpu pinning code assumes that the host operating system is exposed to threads. Due to this, the cores on the PPC architecture are treated as threads by Openstack. Since cores are always less than or equal to the threads on a system, this leads to non-optimal resource usage. Use Cases ---------- * Do optimal NUMA cell affinity based deployments on Power. * Do optimal cpu pinning based deployments on Power. Proposed change =============== Based on the architecture of the host, extensions/classes shall be loaded/called to expose the host operating system scheduling mechanism to Openstack. Since PPC architecture involves core based scheduling, estimated changes would be needed at the following places: * Decide NUMA cell affinity based on cores on the guest vs cores on the host. * Do CPU pinning by having a knowledge of the threads inside each core instead of assuming cores with a single thread. Alternatives ------------ Unless these changes are implemented, the NUMA cell affinity and cpu pinning features will work non-optimally on Power. For normal deployments the users can specify a guest topology using hw_threads, hw_cores with the host flavor or the glance image to ensure that the vcpu threads are run optimally. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Sudipta Biswas sbiswas7 Work Items ---------- 1. Write a ppc specific class/method that considers the host topology in terms of cores and threads mapping while choosing the right NUMA cell for deployment. 2. Change the CPU pinning logic to consider threads per core while pinning decision is made for PPC based architectures. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= The changes will be exercised through unit tests. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Add maxcpus support for qemu/kvm

The purpose of this spec is to create maxcpus option in QEMU
commandline, its required by CPU Hotplug feature of QEMU.

Blueprint add-maxvcpus-flavor-extra-specs

Change-Id: If79038790215541c9cb4e6d3318aea16a11b10f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/12/249012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Add maxcpus support for qemu ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-maxvcpus-flavor-extra-specs The CPU Hotplug has already been supported by qemu(since version 1.5) and libvirt(since version 1.2). This feature is userful for some users to scale VM without reboot. In order to implement the feature, the maxcpus must be specified by qemu command line. You can get more information via the below link. http://wiki.qemu.org/Features/CPUHotplug Problem description =================== In order to add CPU Hotplug feature, the maxcpus must be added to qemu commandline. Currently nova does not support it. Use Cases --------- The core goal is to help other developer to further implement CPU Hotplug in qemu, they are able to implement CPU Hotplug feature via setting "hw:max_vcpus=xx" to flavor's extra specs Proposed change =============== Add "hw:max_vcpus=xx" to flavor's extra specs. The vcpu element of instance's xml would look like this: <vcpu current=2>4</vcpu> Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- AFAIK, some guys are trying to integrating CPU Hotplug feature to nova. They can use the specs to add vcpu for qemu via setting "hw:max_vcpu=xx" to extra specs of flavor Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Yang Wei(wyang8) Work Items ---------- * Libvirt driver will create maxcpus option for cpu. Dependencies ============ * QEMU version must be greater than or equal to 1.5.0 * Libvirt version must be greater than or equal to 1.1.0 Testing ======= The unit tests will of course cover the new code. Some new tests would need to be created to set the extra specs of the flavor and then verify that guest virtual machine has received the expected configuation changes. Documentation Impact ==================== The document should be modified to reflect this new feature. References ========== * http://wiki.qemu.org/Features/CPUHotplug

commit_message:
Add enable-pci-api-function.rst

enable-pci-api-function is focus on use microversion to
enable the previous disabled API due to microversion not ready.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: shaohe_feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>

Change-Id: I398e279bcc9e53f55bfcca9642d87a7698fbe34e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/66/244666/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== Enable PCI functions with microversion ====================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/enable-pci-api-function Problem description =================== Due to bug [1], commit 45591b6d disabled the pci function in the setup.cfg so basically it's waiting for microversion to be enabled. As microversion already enabled and evoluated, it's reasonable to enable this in the microversion. Use Cases ---------- As an user, I want to use pci related API to operator on my PCI resource. Proposed change =============== The pci extensions (nova.api.openstack.compute.pci:Pci) in setup.cfg will be enabled first, then, a microversion will be added on the API, according to doc/source/api_microversion_dev.rst (Adding a new API method) , 404 will be returned to user if the verison is lower than the one will be added to pci. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-pci will be enabled with a microversion bump. because this is not a new added API, it's just API disabled temporarily so please refer to http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#os-pci-v2.1 for more info about the format and parameters. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- novaclient will also be updated to include a corresponding microversion update. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jichenjc Work Items ---------- one patch to include all microversion bump and enablement. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Microversion related unit test will be added. the original PCI controller test will also be enabled. Tempest microversion test is stil on the way, so not covered in this bp. Documentation Impact ==================== API document will be updated to include this microversion bump. References ========== [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1426241 History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Mitaka - Introduced

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/31/219431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== display-flavor-id-in-migration ========================================== Change the output flavor id from InstanceTypes.id to InstanceTypes.flavorid Problem description =================== nova migration-list shows following output (removed not important parts) from nova flavor-list output, there is no flavor ID is 15. The reason is nova has id and flavorid for flavors. The migration-list returns the automatic increment number from colume 'id'. It should return the flavorid since it's used by users later when the nova flavor-show command is used. :: id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True) flavorid = Column(String(255)) :: +----------+----------------------------+----------------------------+ | Instance UUID | Old Flavor | New Flavor | Created At | Updated At | +----------+----------------------------+----------------------------+ | cb7c6742-7b7a-44de-ad5a-8570ee520f9e | 2 | 15 | None | None| +----------+----------------------------+----------------------------+ :: +------+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+---------+-------+ | ID | Name | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap_MB | VCPUs | +------+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+---------+-------+ | 1 | m1.tiny | 512 | 1 | 0 | | 1 | | 100 | m1.test | 1024 | 5 | 0 | | 1 | | 101 | m1.test1 | 512 | 5 | 0 | | 1 | | 2 | m1.small | 2048 | 20 | 0 | | 1 | | 3 | m1.medium | 4096 | 40 | 0 | | 2 | Use Cases ---------- Admin or user query the migration then got the migration info. After that he/she wants to check the flavor info but failed to fine corresponding flavor in the nova flavor-show command. Project Priority ----------------- Not related Proposed change =============== Use Microversion, when the migration info need to be returned, Return flavorid instead of id. Alternatives ------------ Let it be, but the return data is inconvenient to users. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The REST API command :: curl -g -i -X GET http://x.x.x.x:8774/v2/xxxx/os-migrations -X GET The output of the REST API request :: { "migrations": [ {"dest_host": "9.60.29.98", "instance_uuid": "af7abde7-7c2d-4da1-8883-1aa413992a0a", "old_instance_type_id": 21, "updated_at": "2015-07-06T09:45:39.808738", "dest_compute": "tttt", "created_at": "2015-07-06T09:45:37.943918", "status": "error", "source_node": "xxxx", "dest_node": "yyyy", "source_compute": "zzzz", "id": 1, "new_instance_type_id": 22}, ] } The instance type id will be changed to flavorid instead of id. So the output will be below according to the sample given at 'Problem description' section :: { "migrations": [ {"dest_host": "9.60.29.98", "instance_uuid": "af7abde7-7c2d-4da1-8883-1aa413992a0a", "old_instance_type_id": 100, "updated_at": "2015-07-06T09:45:39.808738", "dest_compute": "tttt", "created_at": "2015-07-06T09:45:37.943918", "status": "error", "source_node": "xxxx", "dest_node": "yyyy", "source_compute": "zzzz", "id": 1, "new_instance_type_id": 101}, ] } Security impact --------------- No impact Notifications impact -------------------- No impact Other end user impact --------------------- No impact Performance Impact ------------------ No impact except additional query on the flavor, but the impact can be omitted Other deployer impact --------------------- No impact Developer impact ---------------- No impact Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jichenjc Work Items ---------- Use microversion API to change id to flavorid in migration GET request Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Use unit test and microversion API test. Documentation Impact ==================== APIImpact References ========== https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1391761 History =======

commit_message:
Add volume type to create server API

Currently in create server API, using block_device_mapping
parameter can create cinder volume and attach to instance, but there
aren't volume type parameter to create a SLA based volume, so
this bp will add the volume type to create api.

Change-Id: I990875f0d5d9d892c38982455b021e5a6261464b
Blueprint: enable-volume-types
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/65/241065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== add volume type to create server API ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/enable-volume-types The purpose of this spec is to add volume-type to block_device_mapping parameter nova create instance API. Problem description =================== Currently when creating a new istance, user can call Nova API alongside with "block_device_mapping_v2" which includes desired parameters like " source_type, destination_type, volume_size " defined, to request nova interacting with cinder to create a new volume and attach that volume to the new instance. However, the only volume property can be set by the user in the above mentioned api is volume_size. On contrast, in cinder "create volume" api, user can set both volume size and volume_type which is always used to define the volume SLA/QoS. Therefore it is better for nova api to be aligned with Cinder on this feature so that user can define the volume SLA/QoS level when creating a volume associated with a given instance. Use Cases ---------- * End User creates instance with persistence storage and define the persistence storage SLA/QoS level. Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== The proposal is to add volume_type to block_device_mapping_v2 in nova create instance api. The value of volume_type would be set to none by default, unless when destination_type is volume and source_type is one of {blank, image or snapshot}, user then could specify the value of volume_type. Under this circumstance Nova will save the volume_type value to DB and post it to cinder in create volume api. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- Enhance block_device_mapping object to include volume_type, add volume_type to "BlockDeviceMapping" class in model.py. REST API impact --------------- Volume_type will be added to block_device_mapping_v2 in create server API v2.1. When destination_type is volume and source_type is one of {blank, snapshot or image}, the "volume_type" is valid, Nova accept it, check it from Cinder and deliver to Cinder in create volume request. In other situation, the "volume_type" is invalid and is none by default, Nova will return error when user set it. "block_device_mapping_v2": [ { "device_name": "/dev/sda1", "source_type": "blank", "destination_type": "volume", "volume_type": "HighSLA", "volume_size": "20", "boot_index": "0" }] Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- There will be a new 'volume_type' parameter in Nova boot CLI. The end user will gain from being able to leverage cinder volume types. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zhangni <zhangni@huawei.com> Other contributors: garyk <gkotton@vmware.com> Work Items ---------- * Enhance block_device_mapping_v2 parameter in Nova create instance API. * Enhance block_device_mapping object to include volume_type. * Enhance block_device_mapping table to include volume_type. * Enhance attach function in DriverBlankBlockDevice class to "create_volume" API using volume_type. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add unit test and tempest test for Nova create instance API. Documentation Impact ==================== * CLI Doc http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/content/ * API Doc http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html References ========== Cinder volume_type APIs and volume create API in http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html History ======= None
